business.headline: Donald Trump is a dealmaker: WEF President Børge Brende on potential US trade tariffsWorld Economic Forum President Børge Brende said while some tariffs may be introduced by the US administration, Donald Trump's ultimate goal will likely be to negotiate favourable deals.
Want to avoid paying credit card annual fees? Here are 3 easy tipsSometimes banks may waive your annual fees as a goodwill gesture, if you are a loyal customer with a good credit history.

Global elites' wealth grew 3x faster in 2024; 4 new billionaires weekly: OxfamOxfam International, in its latest assessment of global inequality timed to the opening of the World Economic Forum meeting, also predicts at least five trillionaires will crop up over the next decade. A year ago, the group forecast that only one trillionaire would appear during that time.
Budget 2025: How can government make healthcare more affordableThe healthcare sector expects lowered costs on medical equipment in Budget 2025, thereby boosting affordability and accessibility.

Zomato shares decline 7% as Q3 profit tumbles over 57%Zomato Stock Price: Soon after the Q3 results were released, Zomato shares sharply declined over 7%, hitting a day's low of Rs 228.80. At market closing, the food delivery giant's shares fell 3.14% to Rs 240.95.

Budget 2025: New income tax bill likely to be introduced for simpler taxationThe bill will be introduced directly in Parliament, wherein stakeholder inputs including taxpayers and experts, would be incorporated, before being finalised.

Ian Bremmer sheds light on impact of Trump's second term In an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Ian Bremmer shared his insights on the implications of Donald Trump's second term for the US, India and the world.

Faster PF transfers, direct online claims: Check benefits of new EPFO rulesThe newly introduced measures are expected to minimise the turnaround time, thereby benefiting about 94% of the 13 million claims filed during FY 2024-25.

Sensex jumps 600 points. Why is stock market rising today?Stock market today: While volatility on Dalal Street rose during the trading session, gains in major shares such as Kotak Mahindra Bank, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, SBI and Reliance Industries contributed to the market gains.

Laxmi Dental IPO listing: Shares open at 23% premium on D-Street. Hold or sell?  Laxmi Dental stock price: The shares of Laxmi Dental opened at Rs 528 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) reflecting a gain of 23.36% over its IPO price.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Drill, baby, drill: Donald Trump vows to make America rich againDonald Trump, who took oath as the 47th US President on Monday, said he would declare a 'national energy emergency' to tap the country's oil and gas supplies and promised increased drilling on public lands.

US's exit from Paris Agreement, hiring freeze: Trump signs 1st executive ordersShortly after taking his oath as the 47th US President, Donald Trump signed a total of eight executive orders, including Washington's exit from the Paris Climate Agreement, revoking 78 Biden-era actions and an immediate freeze on government hirings.

PM Modi congratulates 'dear friend' Trump, looks forward to working together againPrime Minister Narendra Modi stated in an X post that he was looking forward to working closely with Donald Trump once again.

Vivek Ramaswamy quits DOGE hours after Donald Trump takes officeIndian-origin entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy won't serve in the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) alongside Elon Musk, hours after Donald Trump took oath as the 47th President of the US.
Viral: Donald Trump, wife Melania's awkward air-kiss moment at oath ceremonyDonald Trump and his wife Melania Trump's awkward air-kiss moment went viral at the oath ceremony.

Trump signs first executive orders to reverse Biden administration's 78 decisionsDonald Trump Swearing In Ceremony Live Updates: Donald Trump took oath as the 47th US President at the Capitol Rotunda in Washington DC on Monday (local time). The inauguration ceremony was shifted indoors because of freezing cold. Trump vowed to act swiftly after the ceremony, signing the first round of executive orders already prepared on immigration and border security. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar represented India at Trump's inauguration event. Follow India Today for all the latest updates.

Trump says he will tariff and tax foreign countries. Trouble for India?US President Donald Trump vowed to overhaul the country's trade system and would impose tariffs and taxes on foreign countries to protect Americans. But would Trump's tariff plans affect India, which he once called the "king of tariffs"?

Day 10 Live: Gauff vs Badosa gets underway, Paul vs Zverev up nextAustralian Open 2025, Day 10 Live Updates: The quarter-finals of the Australian Open are finally here. A series of high octane matches are scheduled for today. The morning will kick off with Coco Gauff taking on Paula Badosa and Alexander Zverev playing vs Tommy Paul. Later in the day, Rohan Bopanna will be in action as we build up to the blockbuster Carlos Alcaraz vs Novak Djokovic clash.
What Melania wore to Donald Trump's Inauguration DayMelania Trump accompanied her husband, President Donald Trump for his inauguration day, dressed in a navy-blue double-breasted outfit.

Pakistan rejoices over Gwadar airport, China dubs it donationThe newly inaugurated Gwadar airport in Balochistan has been branded a "donation" by the Chinese Communist Party's mouthpiece, Global Times. This even as Pakistan hailed the USD 230-million airport as a "symbol of friendship". Critics are calling it another cog in Beijing's debt-trap diplomacy.

Another big Biden move before Trump oath, pardons siblings, family membersMinutes before leaving the White House, Joe Biden pardoned five members of his family, including his brothers, James and Francis Biden, his sister, Valerie Biden, and their spouses.

Virat Kohli confirms availability for Ranji Trophy, set to play vs RailwaysSenior India batter Virat Kohli has confirmed his availability for the Ranji Trophy. Sources at the Delhi and District Cricket Association have told India Today that he will be available to play the match against Railways.

Bengal government to seek death penalty for RG Kar convict: Mamata BanerjeeWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee claimed Kolkata Police could have secured the death penalty for the RG Kar convict and stated that she was not satisfied with the CBI court's verdict.

DOGE faces several lawsuits hours after Donald Trump takes officeUS President Donald Trump has created an advisory group, the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), to drastically cut the US government. Co-run by Elon Musk, DOGE aims to eliminate federal agencies and cut three-quarters of government jobs.

RG Kar convict Sanjay Roy gets life term: What next for him, victim's family?The convict can challenge the order of conviction and sentence before the Kolkata High Court. The CBI also has the provision to seek an enhancement of the sentence to death before a higher court.

'We love you, America': Biden shares last selfie as US President from White HouseThe President shared a heart-warming photograph from his official POTUS handle, featuring a smiling couple posing together in front of the White House.

IIT Madras Director stands by cow urine's 'health benefits' remark amid backlashIIT Madras Director V Kamakoti stuck to his remarks on cow urine. He said he could present research papers that scientifically prove the benefits of cow urine.

'Trump is authentic, stands by his promises': Indian-Americans praise US PresidentAs Donald Trump took office as the 47th US President, a group of Indian-origin veterans, who are also US voters, shared their views on his presidency. They discussed his focus on border security, policies towards China and the tariff threats.

US Senator walks into Trump inauguration in sweatshirt and shorts, video is viralDemocratic Senator John Fetterman attended Donald Trump's oath taking ceremony at the US Capitol Rotunda and wore a black hoodie, grey shorts and sneakers despite the biting cold.

Trump to withdraw from Paris climate deal for second time, says White HousePresident Donald Trump is set to withdraw the United States from the Paris climate deal for the second time, removing the world's biggest historic emitter from global efforts to fight climate change. This move reflects Trump's scepticism about global warming and his agenda to promote US oil and gas production.

4 male staffers were present during Saif Ali Khan attack, didn't intervene: SourcesFour male staff helpers were present inside Saif Ali Khan's home at the time of the stabbing attack, but none intervened to stop the intruder, sources said. One hid himself while the others remained paralysed with fear, they added.

Axar Patel reveals India's new mantra about not having fixed batting slotsIndia all-rounder Axar Patel has revealed that no one in the Indian batting line up has a fixed place in the T20I side apart from the openers ahead of the England series.

India cricketer Rinku Singh to marry Samajwadi Party MP Priya SarojStar Indian batter Rinku Singh is set to get married to Samajwadi Party (SP) MP Priya Saroj, according to her family. Priya's father, Tufani Saroj, confirmed the matrimonial alliance.

Coach Gautam Gambhir, Hardik Pandya in 30-minute chat amid vice-captaincy rumoursDuring India's first training session at the Eden Gardens for the T20I series against England, head coach Gautam Gambhir and Hardik Pandya had an intense discussion for over 30 minutes. Hardik was not named India's vice-captain for the upcoming Champions Trophy.

Watch: Mohammed Shami prepares for England T20Is with intense bowling sessionStar India fast bowler Mohammed Shami has begun preparations for his team India comeback as he engaged in an intense practice session at Eden Gardens ahead of 1st T20I vs England.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
